verses.verse: The famine <WH410> was <WH7706> severe <WH5414> in the <WH7356> land. <WH6440>

It happened, <WH3615> when they had eaten up the grain <WH7668> which they had brought out <WH935> of Egypt, <WH4714> their father <WH1> said <WH559> to them, <WH7725> "Go again, buy <WH7666> us a little <WH4592> more food. <WH400>"

Judah <WH3063> spoke <WH559> to him, <WH559> saying, "The man <WH376> solemnly <WH5749> warned <WH5749> us, <WH559> saying, <WH7200> 'You shall not see my face, <WH6440> unless <WH1115> your brother is with you. <WH251>'
If you <WH3426>'ll send <WH7971> our brother <WH251> with us, <WH3381> we'll go down and buy <WH7666> you food, <WH400>
but if you <WH7971>'ll not send him, <WH3381> we'll not go down, for the man <WH376> said <WH559> to us, <WH7200> 'You shall not see my face, <WH6440> unless your brother is with you. <WH251>'"
Israel <WH3478> said, <WH559> "Why did you treat me so badly, <WH7489> telling <WH5046> the man <WH376> that you had another brother? <WH251>"

They said, <WH559> "The man <WH376> asked <WH7592> directly <WH7592> concerning ourselves, <WH4138> and concerning our relatives, saying, <WH559> <WH1> 'Is your father still alive? <WH2416> Have you <WH3426> another brother? <WH251>' We just <WH5046> answered <WH5921> his <WH6310> questions. <WH1697> Is there any way we could <WH3045> know <WH3045> that he would say, <WH559> <WH3381> 'Bring your brother <WH251> down? <WH3381>'"

Judah <WH3063> said <WH559> to Israel, <WH3478> his father, <WH1> "Send <WH7971> the boy <WH5288> with me, <WH6965> and we'll get up and go, <WH3212> so that we may live, <WH2421> and not die, <WH4191> both we, <WH2945> and you, and also our little ones.

I <WH6148>'ll be collateral for him. <WH3027> From my hand will you require <WH1245> him. <WH518> If I don't <WH518> bring <WH935> him to you, <WH6440> and set <WH3322> him before you, <WH6440> then let me bear the blame forever, <WH2398>
for if we hadn't <WH3884> delayed, <WH4102> surely we would have returned <WH7725> a second time by now. <WH6471>"

Their father, <WH1> Israel, <WH3478> said <WH559> to them, <WH645> "If it must be so, then do <WH6213> this. <WH3947> Take from the choice fruits <WH2173> of the land <WH776> in your bags, <WH3627> and carry down <WH3381> a present <WH4503> for the man, <WH376> a little <WH4592> balm, <WH6875> a little <WH4592> honey, <WH1706> spices <WH5219> and myrrh, <WH3910> nuts, <WH992> and almonds; <WH8247>

and take <WH3947> double <WH4932> money <WH3701> in your hand, <WH3027> and take <WH7725> back <WH3027> the money <WH3701> that was returned <WH7725> in the mouth <WH6310> of your sacks. <WH572> Perhaps it was an oversight. <WH4870>
Take <WH3947> your brother <WH251> also, <WH6965> get up, and return <WH7725> to the man. <WH376>

May God <WH410> Almighty <WH7706> give <WH5414> you mercy <WH7356> before <WH6440> the man, <WH376> that he may release <WH7971> to you your other <WH312> brother <WH251> and Benjamin. <WH1144> If <WH834> I am bereaved <WH7921> of my children, <WH7921> I am bereaved."

The men <WH582> took <WH3947> that <WH2063> present, <WH4503> and they took <WH3947> double <WH4932> money <WH3701> in their hand, <WH3027> and Benjamin; <WH1144> and got up, <WH6965> went down <WH3381> to Egypt, <WH4714> and stood <WH5975> before <WH6440> Joseph. <WH3130>

When Joseph <WH3130> saw <WH7200> Benjamin <WH1144> with <WH854> them, <WH559> he said to the steward of his house, <WH1004> "Bring <WH935> the men <WH582> into the house, <WH1004> and butcher <WH2873> an animal, <WH3559> and prepare; for the men <WH582> will dine <WH398> with me at noon. <WH6672>"
The man <WH376> did <WH6213> as Joseph <WH3130> commanded, <WH559> and the man <WH376> brought <WH935> the men <WH582> to Joseph <WH3130>'s house. <WH1004>

The men <WH582> were afraid, <WH3372> because they were brought <WH935> to Joseph <WH3130>'s house; <WH1004> and they said, <WH559> "Because <WH1697> of the money <WH3701> that was returned <WH7725> in our sacks <WH572> at the first time, <WH8462> we <WH935>'re brought in; that he may seek occasion <WH1556> against us, <WH5307> attack us, <WH3947> and seize us as slaves, <WH5650> along with our donkeys. <WH2543>"
They came near <WH5066> to the steward <WH376> of Joseph <WH3130>'s house, <WH1004> and they spoke <WH1696> to him at the door <WH6607> of the house, <WH1004>
and said, <WH559> "Oh, <WH994> my lord, <WH113> we indeed <WH3381> came down <WH3381> the first time <WH8462> to buy <WH7666> food. <WH400>

When we came <WH935> to the lodging place, <WH4411> we opened <WH6605> our sacks, <WH572> and behold, <WH376> each man's money <WH3701> was in the mouth <WH6310> of his sack, <WH572> our money <WH3701> in full weight. <WH4948> We have brought it back <WH7725> in our hand. <WH3027>
We have brought down <WH3381> other <WH312> money <WH3701> in our hand <WH3027> to buy <WH7666> food. <WH400> We don't <WH3045> know who put <WH7760> our money <WH3701> in our sacks. <WH572>"

He said, <WH559> "Peace <WH7965> be to you. <WH3372> Don't be afraid. Your God, <WH430> and the God <WH430> of your father, <WH1> has given <WH5414> you treasure <WH4301> in your sacks. <WH572> I received <WH935> your money. <WH3701>" He brought <WH3318> Simeon out to them. <WH8095>

The man <WH376> brought <WH935> the men <WH582> into Joseph <WH3130>'s house, <WH1004> and gave <WH5414> them water, <WH4325> and they washed <WH7364> their feet. <WH7272> He gave <WH5414> their donkeys <WH2543> fodder. <WH4554>
They prepared <WH3559> the present <WH4503> for <WH5704> Joseph <WH3130>'s coming <WH935> at noon, <WH6672> for they heard <WH8085> that they should eat <WH398> bread there. <WH3899>

When Joseph <WH3130> came <WH935> home, <WH1004> they brought <WH935> him the present <WH4503> which was in their hand <WH3027> into the house, <WH1004> and bowed <WH7812> themselves down to him to the earth. <WH776>
He asked <WH7592> them of their welfare, <WH7965> and said, <WH559> "Is your father <WH1> well, <WH7965> the old man <WH2205> of whom you spoke? <WH559> Is he yet alive? <WH2416>"
They said, <WH559> "Your servant, <WH5650> our father, <WH1> is well. <WH7965> He is still alive. <WH2416>" They bowed <WH6915> down humbly. <WH7812>

He lifted up <WH5375> his eyes, <WH5869> and saw <WH7200> Benjamin, <WH1144> his brother, <WH251> his mother <WH517>'s son, <WH1121> and said, <WH559> "Is this your youngest <WH6996> brother, <WH251> of whom you spoke <WH559> to me? <WH559>" He said, "God <WH430> be gracious <WH2603> to you, <WH1121> my son."

Joseph <WH3130> hurried, <WH4116> for his heart <WH7356> yearned <WH3648> over his brother; <WH251> and he sought <WH1245> a place to weep. <WH1058> He entered <WH935> into his room, <WH2315> and wept there. <WH1058>
He washed <WH7364> his face, <WH6440> and came out. <WH3318> He controlled <WH662> himself, <WH559> and said, "Serve the <WH7760> meal. <WH3899>"

They served <WH7760> him by himself, <WH4713> and them by themselves, and the Egyptians, that ate <WH398> with him, <WH4713> by themselves, because the Egyptians don't <WH3201> eat <WH398> bread <WH3899> with the Hebrews, <WH5680> for that is an abomination <WH8441> to the Egyptians. <WH4714>

They sat <WH3427> before him, <WH6440> the firstborn <WH1060> according to his birthright, <WH1062> and the youngest <WH6810> according to his youth, <WH6812> and the men <WH582> marveled <WH8539> one <WH376> with another. <WH7453>

He sent <WH5375> portions <WH4864> to them from before him, <WH6440> but Benjamin <WH1144>'s portion <WH4864> was five <WH2568> times <WH3027> as much as <WH7235> any of theirs. <WH8354> They drank, and were merry with him. <WH7937>
